channel.title: Last Day - NEW & UPDATE
channel.description: All NEW and UPDATE articles from the last day with enhanced metadata

item.title: NEW: Sandworm's Failed Wiper Attack on Polish Grid Highlights Critical Infrastructure Risk
item.description:
Headline: Sandworm's Failed Wiper Attack on Polish Grid Highlights Critical Infrastructure Risk

Summary:
On December 29, 2025, the Russian-linked threat actor Sandworm launched a coordinated destructive cyberattack against approximately 30 Polish renewable energy facilities and a manufacturing company. The attackers exploited vulnerable internet-exposed Fortinet FortiGate devices that used default credentials and lacked MFA. After gaining access, they deployed wiper malware, including DynoWiper and LazyWiper, with the intent to cause widespread damage. While the attack was thwarted by EDR software at a major combined heat and power (CHP) plant and ultimately failed to disrupt the power grid, it caused permanent damage to some Industrial Control System (ICS) devices and underscored the significant risk of cyberattacks against distributed energy resources.

Severity: High

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Cyberattack, Threat Actor

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Analysis of the Sandworm group's destructive wiper attack on Polish energy and manufacturing sectors, detailing the exploitation of FortiGate devices and the deployment of DynoWiper and LazyWiper malware.

Article Slug: russian-linked-sandworm-targets-polish-energy-grid-with-wiper-malware

Published Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: eScan Antivirus Update Servers Hijacked to Push Malware in Supply Chain Attack
item.description:
Headline: eScan Antivirus Update Servers Hijacked to Push Malware in Supply Chain Attack

Summary:
On January 20, 2026, the update infrastructure of eScan antivirus, a product by Indian firm MicroWorld Technologies, was compromised in a sophisticated supply chain attack. For a two-hour period, threat actors used a regional update server to push a malicious file named 'Reload.exe' to a subset of enterprise and consumer customers. This file acted as a multi-stage downloader designed to establish persistence, enable remote access, and disable the antivirus product's own protective features. MicroWorld Technologies has since isolated the affected servers and released a patch to remediate the issue.

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Malware, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Details of the supply chain attack against eScan antivirus where update servers were compromised to distribute the 'Reload.exe' malware payload to enterprise and consumer systems.

Article Slug: escan-antivirus-update-servers-compromised-in-supply-chain-attack

Published Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Open VSX Marketplace Hit by Supply Chain Attack Spreading "GlassWorm" Malware
item.description:
Headline: Open VSX Marketplace Hit by Supply Chain Attack Spreading "GlassWorm" Malware

Summary:
On January 30, 2026, the Open VSX Registry, a popular marketplace for Visual Studio Code extensions, fell victim to a supply chain attack. Threat actors compromised the account of a legitimate developer, 'oorzc', and published malicious updates to four of their popular extensions. These updates embedded the 'GlassWorm' malware loader. The compromised extensions had been downloaded over 22,000 times, exposing a large number of developers to the malware before the malicious versions were removed by the Open VSX security team.

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Malware, Cloud Security

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: A supply chain attack on the Open VSX Registry where a compromised developer account was used to publish malicious versions of four extensions, distributing the GlassWorm malware loader.

Article Slug: open-vsx-marketplace-compromised-to-spread-glassworm-malware

Published Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Microsoft Issues Emergency Patch for Actively Exploited Office Zero-Day (CVE-2026-21509)
item.description:
Headline: Microsoft Issues Emergency Patch for Actively Exploited Office Zero-Day (CVE-2026-21509)

Summary:
Microsoft has released an emergency, out-of-band security update to address a zero-day vulnerability in Microsoft Office and Microsoft 365, tracked as CVE-2026-21509. The flaw is a security feature bypass that allows an attacker to circumvent OLE (Object Linking and Embedding) protections by tricking a user into opening a specially crafted file. Microsoft has confirmed that the vulnerability is being actively exploited in targeted attacks in the wild. All users are urged to apply the updates immediately.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Microsoft has released an emergency security update for CVE-2026-21509, a security feature bypass vulnerability in Microsoft Office being actively exploited in the wild.

Article Slug: microsoft-patches-actively-exploited-office-zero-day-cve-2026-21509

Published Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Fortinet Scrambles to Patch Actively Exploited SSO Zero-Day in FortiGate Firewalls
item.description:
Headline: Fortinet Scrambles to Patch Actively Exploited SSO Zero-Day in FortiGate Firewalls

Summary:
Fortinet is urgently rolling out patches for a critical zero-day vulnerability, CVE-2026-24858, that affects the FortiCloud single sign-on (SSO) functionality in FortiGate firewalls. The flaw is being actively exploited in the wild. On January 20th, multiple customers reported that attackers had successfully exploited the vulnerability to gain unauthorized access to their firewalls and create new local administrator accounts. The attacks were successful even on devices running the latest firmware, confirming it as a zero-day. All administrators are urged to patch immediately.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Fortinet is patching a critical, actively exploited zero-day vulnerability (CVE-2026-24858) in FortiCloud SSO that allows attackers to create new administrator accounts on FortiGate firewalls.

Article Slug: fortinet-patches-critical-forticloud-sso-zero-day-cve-2026-24858

Published Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: New "Pulsar RAT" Evades Detection with In-Memory Execution and LoTL Techniques
item.description:
Headline: New "Pulsar RAT" Evades Detection with In-Memory Execution and LoTL Techniques

Summary:
Security researchers have uncovered a new, stealthy Remote Access Trojan (RAT) targeting Windows systems, named 'Pulsar RAT'. This modular, .NET-based malware utilizes a multi-stage infection chain that heavily relies on in-memory execution and living-off-the-land techniques to evade detection. It features advanced anti-analysis capabilities, including anti-VM and anti-debugging checks. Once active, Pulsar RAT provides operators with live, interactive control for credential harvesting and data exfiltration, using legitimate services like Discord and Telegram for command-and-control.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Analysis of the new Pulsar RAT, a modular .NET-based remote access trojan for Windows that uses in-memory execution, anti-analysis techniques, and legitimate web services for C2.

Article Slug: new-pulsar-rat-windows-malware-uses-in-memory-execution

Published Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: "RedKitten" Campaign Deploys AI-Assisted Malware Against Iranian Activists
item.description:
Headline: "RedKitten" Campaign Deploys AI-Assisted Malware Against Iranian Activists

Summary:
A new cyber-espionage campaign in 2026, dubbed 'RedKitten,' has been identified targeting Iranian activists and non-governmental organizations (NGOs). The campaign is notable for using malware that shows signs of being developed with assistance from Large Language Models (LLMs). The attack delivers a C# implant called 'SloppyMIO' via password-protected Excel spreadsheets. The malware is highly sophisticated, using Telegram for C2, leveraging GitHub and Google Drive for payload hosting, and employing steganography to hide its configuration.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Phishing

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Details of the RedKitten cyber-espionage campaign targeting Iranian activists with the SloppyMIO malware, which shows signs of being developed with Large Language Models (LLMs).

Article Slug: redkitten-campaign-uses-ai-assisted-malware-to-target-iranian-activists

Published Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Warning: Malicious ChatGPT Chrome Extensions Steal Session Tokens to Hijack Accounts
item.description:
Headline: Warning: Malicious ChatGPT Chrome Extensions Steal Session Tokens to Hijack Accounts

Summary:
Researchers have identified 16 malicious Google Chrome extensions that masquerade as helpful tools for OpenAI's ChatGPT. Once installed, these extensions inject malicious scripts into the ChatGPT web application. The scripts are designed to monitor outbound requests, intercept sensitive data such as authorization details and session tokens, and exfiltrate them to an attacker-controlled server. This allows the attackers to hijack active user sessions, granting them full access to the victim's account and chat history.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Phishing, Cloud Security

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Researchers have identified 16 malicious Google Chrome extensions that masquerade as ChatGPT tools to inject scripts, steal session tokens, and hijack user accounts.

Article Slug: malicious-chatgpt-chrome-extensions-hijack-user-sessions

Published Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: AI Social Network "Moltbook" Breach Exposes 1.5M API Keys and 29k User Emails
item.description:
Headline: AI Social Network "Moltbook" Breach Exposes 1.5M API Keys and 29k User Emails

Summary:
A significant data breach at the AI-focused social network 'Moltbook' has exposed 1.5 million API keys, 29,000 user emails, and other sensitive data tables. The investigation, conducted by security firm Wiz, not only uncovered the data exposure but also revealed systemic security flaws, such as a lack of rate-limiting on agent registration. The breach also provided a skewed insight into the platform's user base, showing that its 1.5 million 'agents' were owned by only 17,000 human users. Moltbook has since deployed fixes to secure the exposed data.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cloud Security

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: A significant data breach at the AI social network Moltbook exposed 1.5 million API keys, 29,000 user emails, and revealed major security vulnerabilities in the platform's architecture.

Article Slug: moltbook-ai-social-network-breach-exposes-1-5-million-api-keys

Published Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Law Enforcement Closes In on Black Basta Ransomware Group Members
item.description:
Headline: Law Enforcement Closes In on Black Basta Ransomware Group Members

Summary:
In January 2026, a coordinated international law enforcement effort targeted key operators of the Black Basta ransomware group. Ukrainian police conducted searches at the homes of two suspected 'hash-crackers' for the gang, seizing digital evidence. Simultaneously, German federal police publicly identified and issued a warrant for a key member, Oleg Evgenievich Nefedov, who has been added to Europol's EU Most Wanted list. These actions follow the 2025 collapse and internal data leak of the group, which had amassed over $107 million in ransom payments.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Regulatory

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: International law enforcement actions in Ukraine and Germany targeting members of the Black Basta ransomware group, including searches and the public identification of a key operator.

Article Slug: law-enforcement-cracks-down-on-black-basta-ransomware-group

Published Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Over 80% of Malicious Emails Now Use AI, Catalan Agency Warns
item.description:
Headline: Over 80% of Malicious Emails Now Use AI, Catalan Agency Warns

Summary:
A new report from the Catalan Cybersecurity Agency has issued a stark warning about the weaponization of artificial intelligence in phishing attacks. According to their 'Cybersecurity Outlook Report for 2026,' a staggering 82.6% of emails containing malicious links are now crafted using generative AI. The agency's director, Laura Caballero, stated that AI makes scams 'much more sophisticated' and 'almost perfect,' significantly lowering the bar for criminals and making fraudulent emails harder for the average user to detect. The agency advocates for using AI-powered defenses to combat the threat.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Phishing, Threat Intelligence, Policy and Compliance

Article Type: Report

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: A report from the Catalan Cybersecurity Agency reveals that over 82% of malicious emails utilize AI-generated content, significantly increasing the sophistication and difficulty of detecting phishing scams.

Article Slug: over-80-percent-of-email-scams-now-use-ai-catalan-agency-warns

Published Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: OT/IoT Attacks Surge, with 84% Increase in OT Protocol Exploits, Forescout Reports
item.description:
Headline: OT/IoT Attacks Surge, with 84% Increase in OT Protocol Exploits, Forescout Reports

Summary:
A new threat report from Forescout Vedere Labs, analyzing over 900 million attacks throughout 2025, reveals a dramatic increase in attacks targeting Operational Technology (OT) and the Internet of Things (IoT). The report highlights an 84% year-over-year increase in attacks leveraging OT-specific protocols, with Modbus being the most abused. Exploitation of IoT devices like IP cameras also grew. Critically, the report found that 71% of vulnerabilities exploited in the wild were not listed in CISA's Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, complicating prioritization for defenders.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, IoT Security, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: Report

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Forescout's 2025 Threat Roundup report details a significant increase in attacks targeting Operational Technology (OT) and IoT devices, with an 84% rise in the use of OT protocols.

Article Slug: forescout-report-details-rise-in-ot-and-iot-attacks

Published Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: UPDATE: Fortinet Scrambles to Fix Actively Exploited SSO Auth Bypass (CVE-2026-24858) Hijacking Devices
item.description:
Headline: Fortinet Scrambles to Fix Actively Exploited SSO Auth Bypass (CVE-2026-24858) Hijacking Devices

Summary:
Fortinet has disclosed and patched a critical authentication bypass vulnerability, CVE-2026-24858, in its FortiCloud Single Sign-On (SSO) feature. The flaw is being actively exploited, allowing attackers with a FortiCloud account to log into devices registered to other users, leading to unauthorized configuration changes and account creation. The vulnerability affects a wide range of products, including FortiOS, FortiManager, and FortiAnalyzer. Due to the active exploitation and severity, CISA has added CVE-2026-24858 to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, urging users to patch and hunt for signs of compromise immediately.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Patch Management

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: Fortinet is addressing a critical, actively exploited authentication bypass vulnerability (CVE-2026-24858) in its FortiCloud SSO service. Learn how to detect compromise and apply the necessary mitigations.

Article Slug: fortinet-fixes-actively-exploited-sso-authentication-bypass-flaw

Published Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 28 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 12:00:00 GMT

Update Count: 1

Update History: 1 update recorded

Read Full Article →

item.title: UPDATE: New Iran-Linked 'RedKitten' Group Targets Human Rights NGOs with AI-Suspected Malware
item.description:
Headline: New Iran-Linked 'RedKitten' Group Targets Human Rights NGOs with AI-Suspected Malware

Summary:
A new cyber-espionage campaign by a Farsi-speaking threat actor dubbed 'RedKitten' is targeting human rights NGOs and activists documenting abuses in Iran. The campaign, observed by HarfangLab in January 2026, uses phishing emails with macro-laced Excel files as an initial vector. The malware is notable for its modularity and its use of legitimate public services like GitHub, Google Drive, and Telegram for C2 and payload delivery, a technique to evade detection. Researchers suspect the attackers may have used Large Language Models (LLMs) to assist in the development of their sophisticated tooling, marking a potential new trend in malware creation.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Phishing

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: A new Farsi-speaking threat actor, RedKitten, is targeting human rights NGOs with a sophisticated modular malware that uses public services for C2 and may have been developed with AI assistance.

Article Slug: iran-linked-redkitten-campaign-targets-human-rights-ngos

Published Date: Sun, 01 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 01 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 12:00:00 GMT

Update Count: 1

Update History: 1 update recorded

item.title: UPDATE: Microsoft Office Zero-Day Under Active Attack Bypasses Security Features
item.description:
Headline: Microsoft Office Zero-Day Under Active Attack Bypasses Security Features

Summary:
Microsoft has issued an emergency out-of-band patch for a high-severity zero-day vulnerability in Microsoft Office, CVE-2026-21509. The flaw, a security feature bypass with a CVSS score of 7.8, is being actively exploited in the wild through malicious documents. It allows attackers to circumvent Object Linking and Embedding (OLE) protections, leading to code execution if a user opens a specially crafted file. The vulnerability affects a wide range of Office products, including Office 2016 through LTSC 2024 and Microsoft 365 Apps. CISA has added the flaw to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, mandating urgent patching for federal agencies and signaling a significant risk to all organizations.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: Microsoft releases an emergency patch for CVE-2026-21509, a high-severity zero-day vulnerability in Microsoft Office being actively exploited to bypass security features. Learn about the impact and how to mitigate.

Article Slug: microsoft-office-zero-day-cve-2026-21509-actively-exploited

Published Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 10:00:00 GMT

Update Count: 1

Update History: 1 update recorded

item.title: UPDATE: AI to Overtake Human Error as Top Cause of Breaches, Experian Predicts
item.description:
Headline: AI to Overtake Human Error as Top Cause of Breaches, Experian Predicts

Summary:
In its 13th Annual Data Breach Industry Forecast, Experian predicts a paradigm shift in cybersecurity for 2026, with autonomous AI agents potentially surpassing human error as the leading cause of data breaches. The report warns that threat actors are weaponizing AI to create sophisticated polymorphic malware, execute highly personalized attacks, and generate 'pristine synthetic identities' at scale from stolen data. This new wave of AI-driven threats, combined with the looming risk of quantum computing, is expected to fuel a massive spike in identity theft and fundamentally change the nature of cyberattacks.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Policy and Compliance

Article Type: Report

Meta Description: Experian's 2026 Data Breach Forecast predicts that AI agents will surpass human error as the leading cause of data breaches, fueling a rise in synthetic identity fraud and polymorphic malware.

Article Slug: experian-forecasts-ai-agents-to-become-top-cause-of-data-breaches

Published Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Update Count: 1

Update History: 1 update recorded

Read Full Article →

item.title: UPDATE: Attacks on Industrial Environments Doubled in 2025, Report Warns
item.description:
Headline: Attacks on Industrial Environments Doubled in 2025, Report Warns

Summary:
A new report from cybersecurity firm Cyble reveals a dramatic escalation in threats targeting industrial environments. According to its Annual Threat Landscape Report 2025, exploits against industrial technology (IT) and operational technology (OT) systems almost doubled last year. The report, published on January 15, 2026, documented nearly 6,000 ransomware attacks and identified numerous vulnerabilities in internet-exposed assets across critical infrastructure. Cyble predicts that in 2026, attackers will increasingly target exposed Human-Machine Interfaces (HMIs) and SCADA systems. This trend poses a significant risk to major global events, such as the 2026 Winter Olympics, where interconnected vendor systems create a rich target environment for disruption and extortion.

Severity: High

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Cyberattack, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: Report

Reading Time: 7 minutes

Meta Description: A new report from Cyble finds that cyberattacks targeting industrial control systems (ICS) and operational technology (OT) nearly doubled in 2025, with attackers predicted to focus on exposed HMI and SCADA systems.

Article Slug: industrial-control-systems-face-escalating-cyber-threats

Published Date: Fri, 16 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 16 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 02 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Update Count: 1

Update History: 1 update recorded

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: CISA Orders Patching for Critical Ivanti EPMM Zero-Days Under Active Exploitation
item.description:
Headline: CISA Orders Patching for Critical Ivanti EPMM Zero-Days Under Active Exploitation

Summary:
Ivanti has released emergency patches for two critical unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE) vulnerabilities, CVE-2026-1281 and CVE-2026-1340, in its Endpoint Manager Mobile (EPMM) solution. Both flaws are rated 9.8 on the CVSS scale and allow attackers to execute arbitrary code without authentication. With confirmation of active exploitation in the wild, the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added CVE-2026-1281 to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, mandating federal agencies to apply mitigations by February 1, 2026. The vulnerabilities affect multiple versions of EPMM and pose a severe risk to organizations using the platform for mobile device management.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: Ivanti confirms active exploitation of two critical 9.8 CVSS zero-day vulnerabilities (CVE-2026-1281, CVE-2026-1340) in Endpoint Manager Mobile (EPMM). CISA has issued an emergency directive to patch immediately.

Article Slug: ivanti-epmm-critical-zero-day-vulnerabilities-under-active-attack

Published Date: Sun, 01 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 01 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 01 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Russian State Actors Suspected in Destructive Wiper Attack on Polish Energy Infrastructure
item.description:
Headline: Russian State Actors Suspected in Destructive Wiper Attack on Polish Energy Infrastructure

Summary:
On December 29, 2025, a coordinated cyberattack deployed two novel wiper malware variants, DynoWiper and LazyWiper, against more than 30 Polish wind and solar farms and a major combined heat and power (CHP) plant. The attack, aimed at sabotage during severe winter weather, damaged both IT and OT systems. While CERT Polska attributed the incident to the FSB-linked 'Static Tundra' group, other security firms like ESET and Dragos suggest the GRU-backed 'Sandworm' (APT44) is a more likely culprit, noting similarities to previous attacks against Ukrainian infrastructure. The operation involved long-term data theft preceding the destructive phase, with attackers showing interest in SCADA and OT network modernization plans.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Cyberattack, Threat Actor, Malware

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: A coordinated cyberattack using novel wiper malware, DynoWiper and LazyWiper, has targeted over 30 Polish energy facilities. Russian state-sponsored group Sandworm is suspected.

Article Slug: polish-energy-sector-hit-by-destructive-sandworm-linked-wiper-attack

Published Date: Sun, 01 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 01 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 01 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: FBI Shuts Down RAMP, a Notorious Ransomware Recruitment and Trading Hub
item.description:
Headline: FBI Shuts Down RAMP, a Notorious Ransomware Recruitment and Trading Hub

Summary:
In a significant blow to the ransomware ecosystem, the U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) has seized the RAMP (Russian Anonymous MarketPlace) forum. The Russian-language site, which operated on both the clear and dark web, was a central hub for ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) operations. It served as a recruitment ground for affiliates for major gangs like ALPHV/BlackCat and Qilin, a marketplace for initial access brokers, and a trading post for stolen data. The takedown, conducted with the DOJ, disrupts a key piece of infrastructure that enabled numerous high-profile cyberattacks.

Severity: High

Categories: Security Operations, Ransomware, Threat Actor

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: The FBI has seized and taken offline the RAMP (Russian Anonymous MarketPlace) forum, a critical hub for ransomware groups to recruit affiliates, buy initial access, and trade stolen data.

Article Slug: fbi-seizes-ramp-ransomware-forum-in-major-takedown-operation

Published Date: Sun, 01 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 01 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 01 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Supply Chain Attack: eScan Antivirus Update Server Compromised to Distribute Malware
item.description:
Headline: Supply Chain Attack: eScan Antivirus Update Server Compromised to Distribute Malware

Summary:
Indian antivirus provider eScan, a product of MicroWorld Technologies, has suffered a supply chain attack. On January 20, 2026, a regional update server was compromised, causing it to push a malicious file named 'Reload.exe' to enterprise and consumer customers. According to security firm Morphisec, the malware disables the antivirus product by modifying the local HOSTS file to block future updates and then proceeds with a multi-stage infection to download additional payloads. While MicroWorld Technologies acknowledged the breach and isolated the server, it has disputed the 'supply chain attack' label. Affected users require a manual cleaning utility from eScan support for remediation.

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Malware, Incident Response

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: A supply chain attack on antivirus vendor eScan resulted in the distribution of malware to its customers through a compromised update server, disabling the security product.

Article Slug: escan-antivirus-compromised-in-supply-chain-attack-delivers-malware

Published Date: Sun, 01 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 01 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 01 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Vishing Campaign Linked to ShinyHunters Bypasses MFA to Steal Data from SaaS Apps
item.description:
Headline: Vishing Campaign Linked to ShinyHunters Bypasses MFA to Steal Data from SaaS Apps

Summary:
A sophisticated threat campaign, with links to the notorious extortion group ShinyHunters (UNC6240), is using voice phishing (vishing) and custom credential harvesting sites to bypass multi-factor authentication (MFA). Tracked by Mandiant as UNC6661 and UNC6671, the attackers call employees, trick them into entering their single sign-on (SSO) credentials and MFA codes into a fake portal, and then register their own device for persistent access. The goal is to infiltrate corporate networks to steal data from SaaS applications like SharePoint and OneDrive for subsequent extortion. The campaign demonstrates a continued evolution in social engineering tactics designed to defeat modern security controls.

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Threat Actor, Data Breach

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: A sophisticated vishing campaign linked to the ShinyHunters extortion group is targeting employees to steal SSO credentials and bypass MFA, leading to breaches of cloud SaaS platforms.

Article Slug: shinyhunters-style-vishing-campaign-bypasses-mfa-to-breach-saas-platforms

Published Date: Sun, 01 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 01 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 01 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: 'WhisperPair' Bluetooth Flaw Exposes Millions of Headphones and Speakers to Eavesdropping
item.description:
Headline: 'WhisperPair' Bluetooth Flaw Exposes Millions of Headphones and Speakers to Eavesdropping

Summary:
A newly discovered vulnerability named 'WhisperPair' affects millions of Bluetooth audio devices from major brands, including Sony, JBL, and Logitech. The flaw allows a nearby attacker to bypass standard Bluetooth pairing security protocols. Successful exploitation could enable an attacker to eavesdrop on private audio streams or inject malicious audio commands into the connected device. This discovery highlights significant security and privacy risks in widely used consumer electronics and the persistent challenges of securing wireless communication protocols.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Vulnerability, IoT Security, Mobile Security

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: A new Bluetooth vulnerability called 'WhisperPair' affects millions of audio devices from major brands, allowing attackers to bypass pairing security to eavesdrop or inject audio.

Article Slug: whisperpair-bluetooth-flaw-exposes-millions-of-audio-devices

item.title: NEW: UStrive Mentoring Platform Exposes Data of 238,000 Users, Including Minors, via Leaky API
item.description:
Headline: UStrive Mentoring Platform Exposes Data of 238,000 Users, Including Minors, via Leaky API

Summary:
The non-profit mentoring platform UStrive has inadvertently exposed the sensitive personal data of over 238,000 users due to a misconfigured GraphQL API endpoint. A significant portion of the exposed user base includes minors, elevating the severity and privacy implications of the incident. The leaky API could have allowed unauthorized individuals to query and retrieve vast amounts of user data. This breach highlights the critical need for robust cybersecurity practices and secure API implementation, particularly for organizations in the non-profit sector that handle sensitive information, including that of children.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Policy and Compliance, Cloud Security

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: A misconfigured GraphQL API at the non-profit UStrive has led to the data exposure of over 238,000 users, including sensitive information belonging to minors.

Article Slug: mentoring-platform-ustrive-exposes-data-of-238000-users-including-minors

item.title: NEW: Automated Attacks Wipe Exposed MongoDB Databases, Demanding $500 Ransom
item.description:
Headline: Automated Attacks Wipe Exposed MongoDB Databases, Demanding $500 Ransom

Summary:
An automated data extortion campaign is actively targeting publicly exposed and misconfigured MongoDB databases. A threat actor is systematically wiping data from these unsecured servers and leaving a ransom note demanding approximately $500 in Bitcoin for its return. Research from Flare identified over 3,100 MongoDB instances accessible without authentication, with nearly half (1,400) already compromised by this attacker. This campaign highlights the persistent threat of automated scanning and exploitation of basic security misconfigurations, demonstrating that even with lower ransom demands, such attacks remain a profitable venture for criminals preying on low-hanging fruit.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Cyberattack, Data Breach, Cloud Security

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: An automated extortion campaign is wiping thousands of publicly exposed and misconfigured MongoDB databases, leaving a ransom note demanding $500 in Bitcoin.

Article Slug: automated-extortion-attacks-wipe-exposed-mongodb-databases

Published Date: Sun, 01 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 01 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

item.title: NEW: Air Conditioning Giant Blue Star Discloses Data Breach Affecting Product Installation Data
item.description:
Headline: Air Conditioning Giant Blue Star Discloses Data Breach Affecting Product Installation Data

Summary:
Blue Star, a major Indian multinational specializing in air conditioning and commercial refrigeration, has announced it experienced a data security incident. The company reported unauthorized access to its product installation data. The breach was reported to its Compliance Officer on January 31, 2026. Blue Star has engaged external cybersecurity experts to investigate the incident's scope, perform a root cause analysis, and strengthen its security posture. Further details on the extent of the compromise and the responsible party have not yet been released as the investigation is ongoing.

Severity: Low

Categories: Data Breach, Incident Response, Industrial Control Systems

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: Indian multinational Blue Star has reported a data security incident involving unauthorized access to its product installation data. An investigation by external experts is ongoing.

Article Slug: blue-star-reports-data-security-incident-involving-product-data

item.title: NEW: Cybersecurity Risks Mount as Partial US Government Shutdown Begins
item.description:
Headline: Cybersecurity Risks Mount as Partial US Government Shutdown Begins

Summary:
A partial U.S. government shutdown began at midnight on January 31, 2026, after funding for several federal agencies, including the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), lapsed. Security experts are warning that such shutdowns create a period of heightened cybersecurity risk for the nation. With reduced staffing and coordination at key agencies like CISA, the government's ability to detect, respond to, and share intelligence about threats is diminished. Threat actors, both criminal and nation-state, are known to exploit these periods of disruption to launch targeted phishing, credential harvesting, and ransomware campaigns against government agencies and adjacent sectors.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: Analysis

Meta Description: A partial US government shutdown is increasing national cybersecurity risks, as experts warn that diminished federal capacity creates opportunities for threat actors.

Article Slug: partial-us-government-shutdown-heightens-national-cybersecurity-risks

Published Date: Sun, 01 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 01 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 01 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

item.title: NEW: Long-Tail of TriZetto Breach: More Oregon Residents Notified of 2024 PHI Exposure
item.description:
Headline: Long-Tail of TriZetto Breach: More Oregon Residents Notified of 2024 PHI Exposure

Summary:
The consequences of a major 2024 data breach at healthcare insurance verification provider TriZetto Provider Solutions (TPS) are still expanding, with thousands more residents in Oregon now receiving notification letters. The original breach, which occurred in November 2024, involved an intruder accessing sensitive protected health information (PHI) on TriZetto's network. The company did not discover the intrusion for nearly a year. This latest wave of notifications highlights the long and complex tail of supply chain breaches in the healthcare sector and the prolonged risk of identity theft and fraud faced by patients whose data was compromised.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack, Regulatory

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: The 2024 data breach at healthcare vendor TriZetto Provider Solutions continues to expand, with more Oregon residents receiving notifications that their PHI was compromised.

Article Slug: fallout-from-2024-trizetto-data-breach-expands-to-oregon-residents

Published Date: Sun, 01 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 01 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

item.title: UPDATE: Cognizant Sued in Class-Action Lawsuits After TriZetto Data Breach
item.description:
Headline: Cognizant Sued in Class-Action Lawsuits After TriZetto Data Breach

Summary:
IT services giant Cognizant Technology Solutions is facing multiple class-action lawsuits in the U.S. following a significant data breach at its healthcare subsidiary, TriZetto Provider Solutions (TPS). The lawsuits, filed in New Jersey and Missouri, allege that Cognizant failed to adequately protect sensitive patient health and personal information processed by the TriZetto platform. Plaintiffs also claim the company unreasonably delayed notifying affected individuals, preventing them from taking timely steps to protect themselves from fraud and identity theft. The breach at TriZetto, a major processor of healthcare claims, has wide-ranging privacy implications for a large number of patients.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory, Security Operations

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: Cognizant data breach, TriZetto lawsuit, healthcare data breach, HIPAA violation, class action lawsuit, patient data

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: IT giant Cognizant is being sued in multiple class-action lawsuits following a data breach at its healthcare subsidiary TriZetto, with plaintiffs alleging negligence and delayed notification.

Article Slug: cognizant-faces-class-action-lawsuits-over-trizetto-data-breach
